es.usal.bicoverlapper.visualization.diagrams.overlapper
Class ForcedNode

java.lang.Object
  es.usal.bicoverlapper.visualization.diagrams.overlapper.Node
      es.usal.bicoverlapper.visualization.diagrams.overlapper.ForcedNode

public class ForcedNode
extends Node

Force directed nodes. A ForcedNode is a Node to which different forces can be applied to modify its position

Author:
Roberto Therón and Rodrigo Santamaría

Constructor Summary

          Builds a ForcedNode in Graph g at starting position v

 void applyForce(GraphPoint2D v)

 void draw()
          Draw the node as a circle if it is a gene, or as a square if it is a condition.

Method Detail

getMass

public float getMass()
Returns the mass of the ForcedNode. Some kind of forces, as gravitational forces, can have the mass of a node as a parameter to use TODO: By now, this parameter is not being used to compute forces (all nodes have mass 1)

Returns:
the mass of the ForcedNode.

setMass

public void setMass(double m)
Sets the mass of the ForcedNode. Some kind of forces, as gravitational forces, can have the mass of a node as a parameter to use

Parameters:
m - the mass of the ForcedNode.

setForce

public void setForce(GraphPoint2D v)
Sets the force applied to it as a point v (the new position at which this node must be with the force applied)

Parameters:
v - the position at which this node must be with the force applied

setForce

public void setForce(double x,
                     double y)
Sets the force applied to it as the point (x,y), the new position at which this node must be with the force applied

Parameters:
x - x coordinate of the position at which this node must be with the force applied
y - y coordinate of the position at which this node must be with the force applied

applyForce

public void applyForce(GraphPoint2D v)
Adds a force to the current total force applied to the node

Parameters:
v - position that the node must have if this force alone applies to it

draw

public void draw()
Draw the node as a circle if it is a gene, or as a square if it is a condition. The node is only draw if node.isDrawn() is set to false

Overrides:
draw in class Node
